title: Proverbs and Wisdom
description: Learn traditional Brazilian proverbs and sayings

questions.prompt: What does 'Água mole em pedra dura, tanto bate até que fura' mean?
questions.explanation: Like 'constant dripping wears the stone' - persistence achieves results.

questions.prompt: Complete: 'Quem não tem cão, caça com ___'
correct_answers: Quem não tem cão, caça com gato
questions.hint: Meaning: make do with what you have

pairs: De grão em grão a galinha enche o papo
Mais vale tarde do que nunca
Em terra de cego, quem tem um olho é rei
In the land of the blind...

questions.prompt: What does 'Deus ajuda quem cedo madruga' correspond to?
options: God helps those who help themselves
The early bird catches the worm
questions.explanation: Similar to 'the early bird catches the worm' - early risers succeed.

questions.prompt: What proverb means 'The squeaky wheel gets the grease'?
What does 'Quem com ferro fere, com ferro será ferido' mean?
questions.explanation: Similar to 'live by the sword, die by the sword'.

pairs: Não adianta chorar sobre leite derramado
No use crying over spilt milk
A cavalo dado não se olha os dentes
Don't look a gift horse in the mouth
Slow and steady wins the race

content.text: Brazilian proverbs are widely used. Learning them shows cultural fluency and enriches your expression.
Some proverbs vary between Brazil and Portugal. These are the Brazilian versions.
